abstract: Equilar study on executive compensation shows decline of 15 percent for 2015, with average pay  of $19.3 million; report may indicate compensation committees are reining in absolute pay or be reflection of stock market declines; critics remain frustrated that executive pay is not consistently tied to performance, calling it another way economy favors rich.

headline.print_headline: Top C.E.O. Pay Fell — Yes, Fell
headline.main: Top C.E.O. Pay Fell — Yes, Fell — in 2015

snippet: While the top-paid chief executives at the nation’s largest companies received an average of $19 million last year, that figure was down from 2014.
lead_paragraph: While the top-paid chief executives at the nation’s largest companies received an average of $19 million last year, that figure was down from 2014.
